Crimes.Dispute_Type: Leadership and financial management dispute within Salt River First Nation
Crimes.Location_of_Incident: Salt River First Nation, Fort Smith, Northwest Territories
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Lack of knowledge due to improper service of orders
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Insufficient for most defendants, sufficient only for Connie Benwell
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Questionable due to missing pages in affidavits
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Service documents lacked critical information affecting credibility
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Moderate risk of ongoing financial mismanagement
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Unauthorized access to funds and records
Crimes.Governing_Law: Rule 467(4), Rule 468, Rule 470 of NWT Rules of Court
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Court orders dated January 10, January 17, May 29, June 20, 2003
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed for most, granted against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Defective service of show cause order
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Judicial review followed by contempt proceedings
Crimes.Authority: Court's inherent jurisdiction to enforce orders

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Leadership and financial management dispute within Salt River First Nation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of court orders through unauthorized cheque issuance
Crimes.Governing_Law: Rule 467(4), Rule 468, Rule 470 of NWT Rules of Court
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete affidavits of service; limited direct evidence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed for most, granted against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove beyond reasonable doubt
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Missing page 2 of show cause order undermined service validity
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Personal service required; breach must be proven beyond reasonable doubt
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper service of show cause order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unauthorized cheques issued in violation of court orders
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Partial success – only Connie Benwell found in contempt
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Some parties not properly served, affecting fairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Cheque dated April 25, 2003 signed by Connie Benwell
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Civil contempt procedures under territorial rules
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Failure to ensure proper service on all respondents
Crimes.Court_Result: Most motions dismissed, penalty hearing set for Connie Benwell
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Denial or lack of knowledge due to defective service
Crimes.Decision_Authority: Trial judge presiding over contempt motion
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Penalties for breach of court orders
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Party seeking enforcement of court order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Hearsay evidence from other proceedings excluded
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Penalty hearing pending for Connie Benwell

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Leadership and financial management dispute within Salt River First Nation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Unauthorized removal and use of computer containing financial records
Crimes.Governing_Law: Court orders prohibiting unauthorized access to accounts
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Circumstantial; based on witness testimony and records
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed for most, granted against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Lack of direct evidence linking most individuals to data removal
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Compliance with court-ordered restrictions on data access
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Defective service of show cause order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Removal of computer with financial data without consent
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: No proof against most, partial finding against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Judicial_Review_Outcome: Contempt not established for most respondents
Crimes.Review_Standard: Proof of knowledge and intent required
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Service defects affected ability to respond
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Court orders and NWT Rules of Court
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Denial or lack of awareness of orders
Crimes.Legal_Provision: January 10, January 17, May 29, June 20, 2003 court orders
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Irrelevant evidence from other proceedings excluded

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Leadership and financial management dispute within Salt River First Nation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Unauthorized issuance of cheques and removal of financial records
Crimes.Governing_Law: Court orders freezing accounts and requiring dual consent
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Strong on cheque issuance, weak on knowledge and service
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed for most, granted against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Direct evidence only for one transaction
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Prohibition on expenditures without counsel consent
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Defective service of show cause notices
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Issuance of unauthorized cheques violating court orders
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Contempt established only against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Review_Standard: Proof of knowledge and voluntary breach
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Demonstrating knowledge of orders by respondents
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Court orders and NWT Rules of Court
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Lack of notice or knowledge of orders
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Orders dated January 10, January 17, May 29, June 20, 2003
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Evidence from unrelated proceedings deemed irrelevant
Crimes.Governing_Rule: NWT Rules of Court and court orders

Crimes.Crime_Name: Breach of trust by an official
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Leadership and financial management dispute within Salt River First Nation 195
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Violation of fiduciary duties through unauthorized financial actions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Sufficient only for one individual (Connie Benwell)
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed for most, granted against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Service defects undermined claims against others
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Officials must comply with court orders restricting financial control
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper service of show cause order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unauthorized expenditure and disregard of court-ordered controls
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Contempt established only against Connie Benwell
Crimes.Review_Standard: Knowledge and intent to violate order required
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Due process concerns due to service defects
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Proving knowledge of orders by officials
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Lack of proper notice of orders
Crimes.Governing_Rule: NWT Rules of Court and court orders
